hackathon-description-text: UCR and the Inland Empire's premier hackathon.
hackathon-eligibility: Participants must be undergrad students present at the event.
hackathon-rules: Projects must be started within the time limits of the hackathon. Preparation materials are acceptable to have and to use when the event starts, as long as they do not include completed work (such as code).
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Student Recreation Center, 900 University Ave, Riverside, CA 92521, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: You know the drill. A good presentation, well thought-out product, and the raw talent that goes into making your project come to life are the only things that count towards getting your name on the top spot.

hackathon-location-address: Student Recreation Center, 900 University Ave, Riverside, CA 92521, USA
hackathon-description-header: Citrus Hack | UCR's and the Inland Empire's premier hackathon
hackathon-location-description: University of California Riverside, Winston Chung Hall
